title: Men's 10000 m - Speed Skating St. Moritz 1928 Winter Olympics

As a result no medals were awarded and the results are unofficial.","15":null,"16":"Men's 10000 m - Speed Skating - St. Moritz 1928 Winter Olympics Event Format:  Skaters raced against the clock although they raced in pairs on separate lanes on an oval rink (inner and outer lanes). Skaters had to change lanes in the back straightaway of each lap in order to skate an equal distance. The skater on the outer lane had the right of way and the skater leaving the inner lane should avoid collision. The Olympic gold medal winner was the athlete with the fastest time for the race. Event facts: Men's 10000 m competition was held at the Badrutts Park and 10 athletes participated in the event.","17":null,"18":"These results for Men's 10000 m - St. Moritz 1928 Winter Olympics - are based on the official olympic reports and the Olympian Database","19":null},"1":{"0":null,"1":"Men's 10000 m 1928","2":null,"3":"Final","4":null,"5":"Not awarded","6":"Irving Jaffee","7":"Bernt Evensen","8":"Otto Polacsek","9":"Rudolf Riedl","10":"Keistutis Bulota","11":"Armand Carlsen","12":"Valentine Bialas","13":null,"14":"Competition was cancelled due to heavy weather before all 10 competitors had finished their race.
